intro: Echium aequale, commonly known as the common thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Echium aequale thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its hairy leaves and spiny calyces are notable botanical features that aid in its survival in arid environments.
